meanings.definition: To establish vegetation on (an area) again.
meanings.sent1: After the fire, the conservationists revegetated the forest to help it grow back.
meanings.sent2: The community group decided to revegetate the park to make it more beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The park ranger joked that he would revegetate the picnic area with ice cream trees.
meanings.sent4: The gardener's care and attention revegetated the once barren land into a lush paradise.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion seemed to revegetate the wilting flowers, making them bloom again.

meanings.sent1: The farmer revegetates his fields every spring to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent2: The environmental group plans to revegetate the riverbanks to prevent erosion.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully decided to revegetate their sandcastle with tiny toy trees.
meanings.sent4: The old gardener's hands revegetated the garden with love and care.
meanings.sent5: The rain revegetated the dry soil, turning it into a green meadow.
